description:
An exciting late announcement!

Are you free this Saturday 1st March?

Do you want to see the first big international race of the season on the cobbles of Flanders?


We're travelling to see the Omloop Het Nieuwsblad this Saturday 1st March and we have two places left in our vehicle.

The day will include comfortable travel to and from an excellent location for spectating, seeing the race pass by three times at different spots along the route, a bit of hiking between these spots and a standing picnic.

Here's a couple of my photos from recent editions:

It's a hired vehicle so we would ask for a contribution (about EUR35, exact figure to be confirmed) but in return we'll collect you from your Brussels address and take you home afterwards.

Pick-up to be arranged between 09:30 and 10:30

Drop-off between 17:30 and 18:30


Don't miss this opportunity! Just two places left!
name: Day out at Omloop Het Nieuwsblad: 2 places left!

description:
After a brief illness and a longer period of travel, I'm back on the bike here in Belgium, so it's time to try get everyone together for a ride!

The parcours will be:

• On the road (some cobbles possible) in Flemish Brabant


• Around 50-60km

• Average speed of 20-24kph (steady)

• 2-3 hours (no café stops ;-D)


• 9am start to get the benefit of quiet roads, better weather (per current forecast) and the last stages of the Giro d'Italia and Tour of Belgium on TV.

I'll provide more details of the route closer to the day, but as usual be ready for changes during this week dependent on weather and number of riders: if the weather turns sour or we can't get a group of a good size, I'll may have to modify or cancel the meetup :-)

Family, friends and friends of friends are welcome provided that they can also ride safely and responsibly in a group.


Send an email or leave a comment if you have any questions!

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride

description:
Time for another group ride after a few weekends of tedious obligations ;-) You've got plenty of notice this time, so it would be great to meet a few more of you!


The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)

I think we all did fine with an improvised route last time. I only overshot one turn while navigating the whole ride... :-D So we will do that again: Vlaams-Brabant and Wallonie. Probably a little more Wallonie this time.


Distance will be 60-70km (yes, we did a little more last time), average speed will be 20-24kph unless Pawel drills it up the Langestraat again :-D Seriously though, nobody gets left behind, even me!

We might have a café stop if the majority wants one for social reasons, otherwise it will be another through ride.

Any questions, you know what to do. And ahead of this ride, I will supply my phone number to attendees. I forgot to do that last time. Naughty host!

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride

description:
It's now definitely summer and the Tour de France is upon us, so let's turn those legs in tribute with a ride scheduled for Sunday 06 July.


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QLiai4gg_0Q

The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)


As usual, the route around Vlaams-Brabant and Wallonie will be more or less improvised according to feeling thanks to your humble road captain's mastery of the area and his erratic form ;-) Last time I felt bad and Katya kept riding me off her wheel on the hills, so I had to order a coffee stop in my garden which just so happened to be on our route.


The ride will be dependent on weather forecast (so you need to stay informed of activity on this page), distance will be c. 60-70km, average speed will be c. 24kph.

Just to reiterate, this is a road ride with a sport/fitness emphasis, a moderate to brisk pace and the proper group etiquette (pointing out hazards, doing turns on the front etc). You need to be sure you understand and can handle these conditions. Take a look in the comments section of previous group rides for examples of the rides we do.


We may have a café stop if the majority wants one for social, fitness or hygienic reasons, otherwise it will be another through ride.

Any questions, you know what to do. Ahead of this ride, I will supply my phone number to new attendees.

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride

description:
RIDE POSTPONED TO 27 JULY (see comments)


Holiday time in Belgium means more absentees but super quiet roads. Let's enjoy them with our next group ride on Sunday 27 July.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=73ks2TPPyho

Great song there, notwithstanding the two very louche characters therein ... ;)


The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)

I usually improvise the route depending on how everyone is feeling and their capabilities if known to me. The ride will be dependent on weather forecast (so you need to stay informed of activity on this page), distance will be c. 60-70km, average speed will be c. 24kph. We leave punctually at 9:00 and return before 13:00.


This is a road ride for road bikes with a sport/fitness emphasis, a moderate to brisk pace and the proper group etiquette.

You need to be sure you understand and can handle the specified speed and distance. Take a look in the comments section of previous group rides for examples of the rides we do.

You are also responsible for your own kit: food, water bottle, spare tube, tools, minipump, ID and health information where applicable, money.


We may have a café stop if the majority wants one for social, fitness or hygienic reasons, otherwise it will be another through ride.

Any questions, you know what to do. Ahead of this ride, I will supply my phone number to new attendees. If I forget to do so, and I often do, let me know ;-)

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride

description:
On the last ride, there was some interest in moving to a weekly format. I'm not sure we're quite ready for that yet but, since I postponed the last one, it seems only fair that I schedule one for this week per the proper schedule.


So, please join us for another group ride on 03 August subject to weather and sufficient interest.


The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)

This is a road ride for road bikes conducted at a reasonably brisk (though not killer) pace. We have a sport/fitness emphasis and a group etiquette.


The route is almost always improvised with a distance of 70-80km and ridden at an average speed of c. 24kph. The ride will be dependent on weather forecast (so you need to stay informed of activity on this page). We leave punctually at 9:00 and return before 13:00.

For the good of the group, please make sure you understand and can handle the specified average speed and distance. Take a look in the comments section of previous meetups for maps and data from past rides.

You are also responsible for your own kit: food, water bottle, spare tube, tools, minipump, ID and health information where applicable, money.

We may have a stop if the majority wants one for social, fitness or hygienic reasons, otherwise it will be another through ride.

Any questions, you know what to do. Ahead of this ride, I will (probably forget to) supply my phone number to new attendees. Let me know if I forget ;)

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride

description:
Execrable weather is typical during late summer here in Belgium but the good news is that September is often a glorious affair, right when everyone heads back to their daily grind.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rmCpOKtN8ME

Meanwhile, your humble road captain is way off form thanks to a heavy summer cold mushrooming into a sustained bout of bronchitis, followed by a difficult house move. It never rains but it pours, right? ;-D


So, let's accentuate the positive and schedule another group ride on 07 September subject as always to weather and sufficient interest.


The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)

This is a road ride for road bikes conducted at a reasonably brisk (though not killer) pace. We have a sport/fitness emphasis and a group etiquette.


The route is almost always improvised with a distance of 70-80km and ridden at an average speed of c. 24kph. The ride will be dependent on weather forecast (so you need to stay informed of activity on this page). We leave punctually at 9:00 and return before 13:00.

For the good of the group, please make sure you understand and can handle the specified average speed and distance. Take a look in the comments section of previous meetups for maps and data from past rides.

You are also responsible for your own kit: food, water bottle, spare tube, tools, minipump, ID and health information where applicable, money.

We may have a stop if the majority wants one for social, fitness or hygienic reasons, otherwise it will be another through ride.

Any questions, you know what to do! See you there ...

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride: la rentrée

description:
I thought and then forgot about an off-the-bike social occasion but I was reminded of the idea by our very own Master of the Tramlines, BVVC Member Graeme, during the last ride.

So here we go, because even top cyclists need a break.

I won't deny it: this is a selfish initiative from your humble road captain. I have to sit on the front and navigate and I don't get to talk to everyone. Last weekend, BVVC neo-member Staffan rode a solid 50km before I even noticed he was new to the group.


But back to this soirée. It's just a couple of drinks and, quite frankly, our sport is a mere pretext. If indeed you can think of any topic more interesting than cycling, then you are warmly encouraged to share it!


So come along and demonstrate that you have a robust personality as well as good legs. See you there!

Getting there

Cimetière d'Ixelles
Bus 71 - Fernand Cocq, De Brouckère
Bus 95 - Bourse, Sablon, Watermael

Buyl
Tram 7 - Vanderkindere, Montgomery, Rogier


Delta
Métro 10 minutes' walk
name: Social evening (bike not required!)

description:
Break out the full bib tights, folks! After a lengthy period of inactivity (in my case, travelling and three bouts of sickness), BVVC is back with another group ride.


The group ride will take place on Sunday 09 November subject as always to weather and sufficient interest. Regulars should note the slightly later start time.


The usual format: earlyish Sunday morning to allow for televised races in the afternoon, family time, dating and other stuff less important than riding our bikes ;-)

This is a road ride for road bikes conducted at a reasonably brisk (though not killer) pace. We have a sport/fitness emphasis and a group etiquette and we are experienced riders from all over the world.


The route is usually quite hilly, almost always improvised on the day and carries a distance of 80-90km ridden at an average speed of c. 24kph based on a steady start and finish with frequent harder turns during the ride.


For the good of the group, please be sure you can handle the specified average speed and distance. Getting dropped occasionally on the climbs is one thing but it diminishes the value of the ride if we have to come to a full stop to wait for others. Take a look in the comments section of previous meetups for maps and data from past rides.


The ride will be dependent on weather forecast. If conditions are poor before the start, we may cancel, so be sure to check this page frequently. We leave punctually at 09:30 and return before 13:00.

You are also responsible for your own kit: food, water bottle, spare tube, tools, minipump, ID and health information, money.

Any questions, you know what to do! See you there ...

venue.name: Outside Cook and Book, next to Roodebeek Métro exit

name: Group ride: men (and women) in tights!

description:
Proficiat! Our cup overfloweth with new members recently, bringing the total up to fifty, so I thought it might be nice to pull another social evening.

The purpose is, as usual, to ...

a) identify each other without the lycra, helmets and sunglasses (I failed both to recognise and be recognised last time)

b) continue those on-the-bike conversations we had to postpone because the hill we were climbing got too steep for talking


c) explore the remote planets of other conversation topics not necessarily related to cycling


Central Brussels venue (Monk, Sainte-Catherine / Sint-Katelijne) unless anyone has any other preferences. Let me know if you have any questions. See you there!


Getting there

Métro
Sainte-Catherine / Sint-Katelijne
Lines 1, 5
name: Social evening (bike not required!)
